ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: This course primarily consisted of virtual meetings with my senior essay advisor.  The senior essay consultant for EP&E offered one group workshop at the beginning of the semester.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Writing my senior essay developed my long-term research skills in many ways.  I was able to craft an appropriate research question, generate a thesis sustainable over 40 pages, and put together a cohesive paper.  I also learned how to work effectively and virtually with a research advisor, respecting deadlines and incorporating detailed feedback.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Because I chose a strong advisor, this aspect of the course was wonderful.  Our weekly meetings greatly enhanced my final product.

The EP&E major, however, provided little to no outside support for my research.  One workshop was scheduled by the senior essay consultant, but it offered little guidance for my writing.  After this workshop, communication from the department went silent.  If not for my weekly advisor meetings, I would be totally in the dark about my essay.  This lack of engagement is unacceptable, and I hope the EP&E leadership changes its approach in future semesters.

For reference, the EP&E website notes that *three* workshops will be held over the semester, with attendance required at each.  By contrast, this semester only had one preliminary workshop.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Virtual engagement is never ideal, but my advisor made every effort to maintain a regular meeting schedule.  In this respect, there is not much room for improvement, since we probably met on Zoom more than we would have in person.

On the other hand, the EP&E program failed to establish contact after the first workshop.  This was made more difficult by the senior essay consultant occasionally not responding to emails and a lack of DUS office hours.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
If you are an independent writer with little need for structured research assistance, then yes, go for this course.  Writing a senior essay across three disciplines is a fantastic experience.

If you would prefer more support from the major in your research, I recommend you pursue a different course of study.
